books.title: The Blazing World
books.author: Margaret Cavendish
books.summary: A young lady is abducted and finds herself the empress of a strange new world.

books.title: Room 13
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A recently-released prisoner discovers that his love, the daughter of an old friend, has married a sinister imposter.

books.title: Confessions of an English Opium-Eater
books.author: Thomas De Quincey
books.summary: A portrait of the life of a drug addict in Georgian-era London.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Heidi
books.author: Johanna Spyri
books.summary: A small girl is left with her grandfather and falls in love with his alpine home.

books.title: School Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s school stories about the lives and adventures of schoolboys in the early 1900s.

books.title: The Comedy of Errors
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Two sets of identical twins are mistaken for their lost siblings.

books.title: Jurgen
books.author: James Branch Cabell
books.summary: Jurgen, a pawnbroker and “monstrous clever fellow,” is sent on a witty and parodic magical journey in search of true love.

books.title: The House of the Seven Gables
books.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
books.summary: A dignified but poor woman and her young relative open a shop in a room of a house with a dark history.

books.title: The House on the Borderland
books.author: William Hope Hodgson
books.summary: An account of the terrifying metaphysical haunting of a recluse’s secluded home.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: Poirot Investigates
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A calculating Belgian detective and his wide-eyed companion investigate and solve a series of mysteries.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.

books.title: Principia Ethica
books.author: G. E. Moore
books.summary: An analysis of the concept of good that diagnoses the history of ethics as being marred by the “naturalistic fallacy” while discussing intrinsic goods and evils.

books.title: Verses on Various Occasions
books.author: John Henry Newman
books.summary: A collection of poems by John Henry Newman.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: Triplanetary
books.author: E. E. Smith
books.summary: In a universe where all powerful alien races influence the fates of worlds, a war erupts between the Triplanetary League of the inner solar system, pirates led by a mysterious and malicious scientist, and technologically advanced aliens.

books.title: The Confessions of Arsène Lupin
books.author: Maurice Leblanc
books.summary: The gentleman-thief relates stories of his outwitting the Parisian detectives.

books.title: The Pilgrim Kamanita
books.author: Karl Gjellerup
books.summary: An Indian merchant’s son sets on a pilgrimage after a life of love, loss, business, and pleasure, and unknowingly relates his tale to the Buddha.

books.title: To Cuba and Back
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A captivating travel memoir recounting an 1859 journey to Cuba, offering vivid descriptions of the island’s culture, landscapes, and people.
